intro: Aschenfeldtia, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or purple flowers and palmate leaves. Aschenfeldtia species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
